history.content:
188 should be the easier curriculum (as in its easy to understand the content) and workload, but the exams are notoriously hard, I haven't taken either yet but I've heard 182 is easier than 189. I'd imagine you probably would want to avoid 189 because of high workload.

If you're willing to take the class P/NP I guess you could just choose whichever one interests you most? Which sounds like 182.

children.subject: As someone who did 188 while doing an internship where I worked 60-70 hours a week and was enrolled in 189 and 182 (182 for a bit), CS188 is the most manageable out all of those 3.
I thought they would provide credits for co-ops under CS194-XX but I may be wrong. Can someone verify?
Does Berkeley offer units if we do an internship?

history.content:
So, unfortunately, I'm in a sticky situation where applying for a reduced course load isn't a viable option. Yet, I received an offer for a spring internship where they said the workload would be around 40-50 hrs/week. I'm really passionate about doing a lot at the company so that I can learn. 

But when I have to take a 13 minimum unit schedule, it seems a bit tough and I wanted some opinions on what CS class I should take. I have 3 units for a very easy breadth, 4 units from the internship coop (do I have to sign up for this somewhere btw?), and 2 units for being a senior mentor at CSM. I have 4 units left, and currently enrolled in 182, 189, but also considering 188. 

Which of the three do you think would be doable with my schedule? 182 is most directly related to what I'll be doing at work, but I heard it can be a bit of a workload. I'm open to any other open classes as well. For context, I'm a junior with all lower divs except 16B finished, and did 54, ds100, 170 162 161 and 186 so far. I don't mind PNPing the class too if it gets too much to deal with -- just trying to knock out the requirements so that I can graduate
history.subject: full time internship + full time student schedule
